info.title: OpenEye Microservices
info.description: Collection of Services that use the OpenEye toolkits

get.description: Render 2D depictions of small molecules using the OEDepict Toolkit. This resource requires two different parameters: {fmt} in the URL path, which specifies the molecule file format (e.g. pdb, sdf, etc.); and val in the query string, which is the molecule file string (e.g. anything from a simple SMILES string to a URL encoded PDB file). Remember that URLs have a 2083 character limit, so use the POST method if you plan to use lengthy molecule files. If the debug parameter is false or not specified, then any error will result in a 200 OK response and a PNG image with an error message rendered onto it. This allows pages to render without missing images, even if there are errors.

parameters.name: highlightcolor
parameters.description: Hex RGB (RRGGBB) color for highlighting substructures

post.description: Render 2D depictions of small molecules using the OEDepict Toolkit. Similar to the GET method, this resource requires a {fmt} parameter in the URL path to specify the moleucle format. The only difference is that the raw molecule file string is placed in the body of the post (e.g. the PDB or SD file). Similar to the GET method, if the debug parameter is false or not specified, then any error will result in a 200 OK repsonse and a PNG image with an error message rendered onto it. This allows pages to render without missing images, even if there are errors.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Hex RGB (RRGGBB) color for highlighting substructures

get.description: Render 2D depictions of small molecules using the OEDepict Toolkit. This resource requires only the {molecule} parameter in either the URL or body if using a SMILES string.  If molecule is in another format use the molfmt query string to indicate string type (pdf, sdf, etc.) Remember that URLs have a 2083 character limit, so use the POST method  if you plan to use lengthy molecule files. If the debug parameter is  false or not specified, then any error will result in a 200 OK response  and a PNG image with an error message rendered onto it. This allows  pages to render without missing images, even if there are errors. Version 2 of this API now allows highlighting atom sets by color.  To do atom labeling, please see the POST methods below.

post.description: ** Note that this API should be used without the trailing slash ** (multiple POST APIs for the same route are not enabled by Swagger). In this implementation the molecule is posted as a string in the body of the request and all other parameters are set via the URL.  This method  can be used to POST structures that would exceed the 2083 character  limit within URLs.

This is a JSON POST convenience method for image rendering.  The  molecule field is obviously required and all other parameters are the same as the above methods with the exception of the highlight-atoms-JSON object.

molecule.description: String representation of molecule (optional) in case not loaded via path

titleloc.description: Location of title relative to molecule

gz.description: Whether or not the molecule string is gzipped

scalebonds.description: Scale bond width with molecule size

background.description: Hex RGB (RRGGBB) or hex RGBA (RRGGBBAA) string that defines the background

debug.description: Return a JSON response on error rather than an error image

size.description: Size of square image in pixels.  To set a non-square image size, use width and height

width.description: Width of image.  If null defaults to size parameter.

height.description: Height of image.  If null defaults to size parameter.

highlight-color.description: One or more Hex RGB (RRGGBB) colors for highlighting substructures or one of the following OE default sets. default, contrast, deep, light (default), vivid.

highlight-style.description: The molecule highlight style as one of the following default, ballandstick, stick, lasso, color, cogwheel (default)

highlight-nest.description: If highlighting overlaps, whether to nest highlights or keep all the same width

highlight-scale.description: Relative scale of highlighting.  Default is 0 and goes up from there.

atom-indices.description: List of atom numbers to highlight as a set

color.description: Hex RGB color to highlight with

highlight-atoms-JSON.description: Array of JSON objects containing atom index set / color pairs

atom-labels.description: Array of array doublets where each set consists of an [atom number, label] pair

bond-labels.description: Array of array doublets where each set consists of a [bond number, label] pair

label-color.description: Color of atom / bond label text, default is

label-style.description: Font style of atom / bond labels (default is normal)

post.description: Render a receptor-ligand interaction map (also known as a 2.5D image). This resource requires a POST with a specific JSON string that contains the split ligand and receptor. The individual file formats of the ligand and receptor are specified in the string, as well as if they are compressed. If you do not have the ligand and receptor split, consider using the '/v1/depict/interaction/search/{fmt}' resource, which has query parameters that allow the ligand to specified within a single file that contains both the ligand and receptor. Similar to the other ligand depiction resources, if debug is not specified, any error will still produce a 200 OK response and a PNG image with an error message rendered onto it. This allows pages to render without missing images, even if there are errors.

parameters.name: jsonString
parameters.description: The split receptor and ligand files as JSON

post.description: Render a receptor-ligand interaction map (also known as a 2.5D image). This resource only requires the raw molecule file containing both the ligand and receptor to be contained in the POST body. The 'resi', 'resn', and 'chain' query parameters can then be used in any combination to specify the ligand within the receptor. If your ligand and receptor are already split into two different files, consider using the '/v1/depict/interaction' instead. Similar to the other ligand depiction resources, if debug is not specified, any error will still produce a 200 OK response and a PNG image with an error message rendered onto it. This allows pages to render without missing images, even if there are errors.

Convert between different molecule file formats. This resource expects a JSON object that defines both the molecule input and output format information. A JSON response is produce that provides the output molecule as well as echoing the output format information.

parameters.name: jsonString
parameters.description: The molecule and I/O format infomration

MoleculeConvertRequest.description: A molecule with input and output conversion information

value.description: A string containing the input molecule

format.description: The file format of the input molecule string

gz.description: If the input molecule string is gzipped and then base64 encoded

format.description: The file format of the output molecule string

gz.description: If the output molecule string should be gzipped and then base64 encoded

Molecule.description: A molecule string with accompanying file format description

format.description: The file format of the molecule string

gz.description: If the molecule string is gzipped and base64 encoded

titleLocParam.name: titleloc
titleLocParam.description: The location of the title (if one exists)

gzParam.name: gz
gzParam.description: Molecule file string is gzipped and then base64 encoded

scaleBondsParam.name: scalebonds
scaleBondsParam.description: Scale bond width with molecule size

backgroundParam.name: background
backgroundParam.description: Hex RGB (RRGGBB) or hex RGBA (RRGGBBAA) string that defines the background color

debugParam.name: debug
debugParam.description: Return a JSON response on error rather than an error image

fmtPathParam.name: fmt
fmtPathParam.description: The file format of the molecule string

molFmtParam.name: molfmt
molFmtParam.description: The file format of the molecule string

nameParam.name: size
nameParam.description: The image size for a square image.

widthParam.name: width
widthParam.description: The image width.  If height is set, default is size param.

heightParam.name: height
heightParam.description: The image height.  If width is set, default is size param.

highlightColorParam.name: highlight-color
highlightColorParam.description: One or more Hex RGB (RRGGBB) colors for highlighting substructures or one of the following OE default sets. default, contrast, deep, light (default), vivid.

highlightStyleParam.name: highlight-style
highlightStyleParam.description: The molecule highlight style as one of the following default, ballandstick, stick, lasso, color, cogwheel (default)

highlightNestParam.name: highlight-nest
highlightNestParam.description: If highlighting overlaps, whether to nest highlights or keep all the same width

highlightScaleParam.name: highlight-scale
highlightScaleParam.description: Relative scale of highlighting.  Default is 0 and goes up from there.

highlightAtomsParam.name: highlight-atoms
highlightAtomsParam.description: Common set of atom numbers to highlight, separated by commas (and URL encoded).  Multiple atom sets are allowed.

highlightAtomsColorsParam.name: highlight-atoms-colors
highlightAtomsColorsParam.description: Optional colors to use to highlight atom sets.  If multiple sets are provided in highlight-atoms, corresponding highlight-atoms-colors should be provided in the same order.  Where colors are not available, or where array lengths don't match, default coloring will fall back to the highlight-color parameter.
